response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Employee> it = employees.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
    Employee emp = it.next();
    if(emp.getDepartment().getMinSal() > emp.getSalary()){
        emp.setMinSal(emp.getSalary());
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can iterate through the list of employees and check the minimum salary of each employee in their respective department. If the minimum salary of an employee is greater than their current minimum salary, you can update the minimum salary for that employee.
